discussion.author: felipenoris
discussion.text:
* Naming: I assumed the name `BLPAPI` (or `Blpapi`) was taken by JuliaComputing, so I used BLP. This package does not have an obvious alternative name, and I accept suggestions.

* build fails: the CI tried to install on linux. Currently this is a Windows-only package in this initial release.

discussion.author: DilumAluthge
discussion.text:
>     * build fails: the CI tried to install on linux. Currently this is a Windows-only package in this initial release.

That is fine.

>     * Naming: I assumed the name `BLPAPI` (or `Blpapi`) was taken by JuliaComputing, so I used BLP. This package does not have an obvious alternative name, and I accept suggestions.

I would **very strongly** recommend a longer and more descriptive package name.

How about:
- `Bloomberg.jl`
- `BloombergAPI.jl`
- `BloombergData.jl`
- `BloombergFinance.jl`

discussion.author: felipenoris
discussion.text: @DilumAluthge , I'm afraid those names are Bloomberg trademarks. Most packages go with Blpapi name.

discussion.author: DilumAluthge
discussion.text: Cool. I'll close this PR, and you can make a new registration after you have renamed the package.
